heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: This period, starting 02 February 2026, is ranked 5th among the longest windy periods since 23 September 2024.  It has lasted 4 days so far.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%) and rainfall (up 1.0 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 348 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 121 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 347.5m lower than yesterday, 120.3m lower than the past week, 121.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 530m and a peak of 1993m, averaging 663.2m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and near calm conditions. Some rain can be expected, overcast skies with low cloud, and dim or diffuse light conditions. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
